ddX  1.0.0
Libary for domain-decomposition methods for polarizable continuum models
ddx_harmonics.f90
Go to the documentation of this file.

16 module ddx_harmonics
17 
18 ! Get all compile-time definitions
19 use ddx_definitions
20 
21 ! Disable implicit types
22 implicit none
23 
24 contains
25 
37 subroutine ylmscale(p, vscales, v4pi2lp1, vscales_rel)
38  ! Input
39  integer, intent(in) :: p
40  ! Output
41  real(dp), intent(out) :: vscales((p+1)**2), v4pi2lp1(p+1), &
42  & vscales_rel((p+1)**2)
43  ! Local variables
44  real(dp) :: tmp, twolp1
45  integer :: l, ind, m
46  twolp1 = one
47  do l = 0, p
48  ! m = 0
49  ind = l*l + l + 1
50  tmp = fourpi / twolp1
51  v4pi2lp1(l+1) = tmp
52  tmp = sqrt(tmp)
53  vscales_rel(ind) = tmp
54  vscales(ind) = one / tmp
55  twolp1 = twolp1 + two
56  tmp = vscales(ind) * sqrt2
57  ! m != 0
58  do m = 1, l
59  tmp = -tmp / sqrt(dble((l-m+1)*(l+m)))
60  vscales(ind+m) = tmp
61  vscales(ind-m) = tmp
62  vscales_rel(ind+m) = tmp * v4pi2lp1(l+1)
63  vscales_rel(ind-m) = vscales_rel(ind+m)
64  end do
65  end do
66 end subroutine ylmscale
67 
80 subroutine fmm_constants(dmax, pm, pl, vcnk, m2l_ztranslate_coef, &
81  & m2l_ztranslate_adj_coef)
82  ! Inputs
83  integer, intent(in) :: dmax, pm, pl
84  ! Outputs
85  real(dp), intent(out) :: vcnk((2*dmax+1)*(dmax+1)), &
86  & m2l_ztranslate_coef(pm+1, pl+1, pl+1), &
87  & m2l_ztranslate_adj_coef(pl+1, pl+1, pm+1)
88  ! Local variables
89  integer :: i, indi, j, k, n, indjn
90  real(dp) :: tmp1
91  ! Compute combinatorial numbers C_n^k for n=0..dmax
92  ! C_0^0 = 1
93  vcnk(1) = one
94  do i = 2, 2*dmax+1
95  ! Offset to the C_{i-2}^{i-2}, next item to be stored is C_{i-1}^0
96  indi = (i-1) * i / 2
97  ! C_{i-1}^0 = 1
98  vcnk(indi+1) = one
99  ! C_{i-1}^{i-1} = 1
100  vcnk(indi+i) = one
101  ! C_{i-1}^{j-1} = C_{i-2}^{j-1} + C_{i-2}^{j-2}
102  ! Offset to C_{i-3}^{i-3} is indi-i+1
103  do j = 2, i-1
104  vcnk(indi+j) = vcnk(indi-i+j+1) + vcnk(indi-i+j)
105  end do
106  end do
107  ! Get square roots of C_n^k. sqrt(one) is one, so no need to update C_n^0
108  ! and C_n^n
109  do i = 3, 2*dmax+1
110  indi = (i-1) * i / 2
111  do j = 2, i-1
112  vcnk(indi+j) = sqrt(vcnk(indi+j))
113  end do
114  end do
115  ! Fill in m2l_ztranslate_coef and m2l_ztranslate_adj_coef
116  do j = 0, pl
117  do k = 0, j
118  tmp1 = one
119  do n = k, pm
120  indjn = (j+n)*(j+n+1)/2 + 1
121  m2l_ztranslate_coef(n-k+1, k+1, j-k+1) = &
122  & tmp1 * vcnk(indjn+j-k) * vcnk(indjn+j+k)
123  m2l_ztranslate_adj_coef(j-k+1, k+1, n-k+1) = &
124  & m2l_ztranslate_coef(n-k+1, k+1, j-k+1)
125  tmp1 = -tmp1
126  end do
127  end do
128  end do
129 end subroutine fmm_constants
130 
142 subroutine carttosph(x, rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi)
143  ! Input
144  real(dp), intent(in) :: x(3)
145  ! Output
146  real(dp), intent(out) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi
147  ! Local variables
148  real(dp) :: max12, ssq12
149  ! Check x(1:2) = 0
150  if ((x(1) .eq. zero) .and. (x(2) .eq. zero)) then
151  rho = abs(x(3))
152  ctheta = sign(one, x(3))
153  stheta = zero
154  cphi = one
155  sphi = zero
156  return
157  end if
158  ! In other situations use sum-of-scaled-squares technique
159  ! Get norm of x(1:2) and cphi with sphi outputs
160  if (abs(x(2)) .gt. abs(x(1))) then
161  max12 = abs(x(2))
162  ssq12 = one + (x(1)/x(2))**2
163  else
164  max12 = abs(x(1))
165  ssq12 = one + (x(2)/x(1))**2
166  end if
167  stheta = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
168  cphi = x(1) / stheta
169  sphi = x(2) / stheta
170  ! Then compute rho, ctheta and stheta outputs
171  if (abs(x(3)) .gt. max12) then
172  rho = one + ssq12*(max12/x(3))**2
173  rho = abs(x(3)) * sqrt(rho)
174  stheta = stheta / rho
175  ctheta = x(3) / rho
176  else
177  rho = ssq12 + (x(3)/max12)**2
178  rho = max12 * sqrt(rho)
179  stheta = stheta / rho
180  ctheta = x(3) / rho
181  end if
182 end subroutine carttosph
183 
214 subroutine ylmbas(x, rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, p, vscales, vylm, vplm, &
215  & vcos, vsin)
216  ! Inputs
217  integer, intent(in) :: p
218  real(dp), intent(in) :: x(3)
219  real(dp), intent(in) :: vscales((p+1)**2)
220  ! Outputs
221  real(dp), intent(out) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi
222  real(dp), intent(out) :: vylm((p+1)**2), vplm((p+1)**2)
223  real(dp), intent(out) :: vcos(p+1), vsin(p+1)
224  ! Local variables
225  integer :: l, m, ind
226  real(dp) :: max12, ssq12, tmp
227  ! Get rho cos(theta), sin(theta), cos(phi) and sin(phi) from the cartesian
228  ! coordinates of x. To support full range of inputs we do it via a scale
229  ! and a sum of squares technique.
230  ! At first we compute x(1)**2 + x(2)**2
231  if (x(1) .eq. zero) then
232  max12 = abs(x(2))
233  ssq12 = one
234  else if (abs(x(2)) .gt. abs(x(1))) then
235  max12 = abs(x(2))
236  ssq12 = one + (x(1)/x(2))**2
237  else
238  max12 = abs(x(1))
239  ssq12 = one + (x(2)/x(1))**2
240  end if
241  ! Then we compute rho
242  if (x(3) .eq. zero) then
243  rho = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
244  else if (abs(x(3)) .gt. max12) then
245  rho = one + ssq12 *(max12/x(3))**2
246  rho = abs(x(3)) * sqrt(rho)
247  else
248  rho = ssq12 + (x(3)/max12)**2
249  rho = max12 * sqrt(rho)
250  end if
251  ! In case x=0 just exit without setting any other variable
252  if (rho .eq. zero) then
253  return
254  end if
255  ! Length of a vector x(1:2)
256  stheta = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
257  ! Case x(1:2) != 0
258  if (stheta .ne. zero) then
259  ! Normalize cphi and sphi
260  cphi = x(1) / stheta
261  sphi = x(2) / stheta
262  ! Normalize ctheta and stheta
263  ctheta = x(3) / rho
264  stheta = stheta / rho
265  ! Treat easy cases
266  select case(p)
267  case (0)
268  vylm(1) = vscales(1)
269  return
270  case (1)
271  vylm(1) = vscales(1)
272  vylm(2) = - vscales(4) * stheta * sphi
273  vylm(3) = vscales(3) * ctheta
274  vylm(4) = - vscales(4) * stheta * cphi
275  return
276  end select
277  ! Evaluate associated Legendre polynomials, size of temporary workspace
278  ! here needs only (p+1) elements so we use vcos as a temporary
279  call polleg_work(ctheta, stheta, p, vplm, vcos)
280  ! Evaluate cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) arrays
281  call trgev(cphi, sphi, p, vcos, vsin)
282  ! Construct spherical harmonics
283  ! l = 0
284  vylm(1) = vscales(1)
285  ! l = 1
286  vylm(2) = - vscales(4) * stheta * sphi
287  vylm(3) = vscales(3) * ctheta
288  vylm(4) = - vscales(4) * stheta * cphi
289  ind = 3
290  do l = 2, p
291  ! Offset of a Y_l^0 harmonic in vplm and vylm arrays
292  ind = ind + 2*l
293  !l**2 + l + 1
294  ! m = 0 implicitly uses `vcos(1) = 1`
295  vylm(ind) = vscales(ind) * vplm(ind)
296  do m = 1, l
297  ! only P_l^m for non-negative m is used/defined
298  tmp = vplm(ind+m) * vscales(ind+m)
299  ! m > 0
300  vylm(ind+m) = tmp * vcos(m+1)
301  ! m < 0
302  vylm(ind-m) = tmp * vsin(m+1)
303  end do
304  end do
305  ! Case of x(1:2) = 0 and x(3) != 0
306  else
307  ! Set spherical coordinates
308  cphi = one
309  sphi = zero
310  ctheta = sign(one, x(3))
311  stheta = zero
312  ! Set output arrays vcos and vsin
313  vcos = one
314  vsin = zero
315  ! Evaluate spherical harmonics. P_l^m = 0 for m > 0. In the case m = 0
316  ! it depends if l is odd or even. Additionally, vcos = one and vsin =
317  ! zero for all elements
318  vylm = zero
319  vplm = zero
320  do l = 0, p, 2
321  ind = l**2 + l + 1
322  ! only case m = 0
323  vplm(ind) = one
324  vylm(ind) = vscales(ind)
325  end do
326  do l = 1, p, 2
327  ind = l**2 + l + 1
328  ! only case m = 0
329  vplm(ind) = ctheta
330  vylm(ind) = ctheta * vscales(ind)
331  end do
332  end if
333 end subroutine ylmbas
334 
348 subroutine trgev(cphi, sphi, p, vcos, vsin)
349  ! Inputs
350  integer, intent(in) :: p
351  real(dp), intent(in) :: cphi, sphi
352  ! Output
353  real(dp), intent(out) :: vcos(p+1), vsin(p+1)
354  ! Local variables
355  integer :: m
356  real(dp) :: c4phi, s4phi
357  !! Treat values of p from 0 to 3 differently
358  select case(p)
359  ! Do nothing if p < 0
360  case (:-1)
361  return
362  ! p = 0
363  case (0)
364  vcos(1) = one
365  vsin(1) = zero
366  return
367  ! p = 1
368  case (1)
369  vcos(1) = one
370  vsin(1) = zero
371  vcos(2) = cphi
372  vsin(2) = sphi
373  return
374  ! p = 2
375  case (2)
376  vcos(1) = one
377  vsin(1) = zero
378  vcos(2) = cphi
379  vsin(2) = sphi
380  vcos(3) = cphi**2 - sphi**2
381  vsin(3) = 2 * cphi * sphi
382  return
383  ! p = 3
384  case (3)
385  vcos(1) = one
386  vsin(1) = zero
387  vcos(2) = cphi
388  vsin(2) = sphi
389  vcos(3) = cphi**2 - sphi**2
390  vsin(3) = 2 * cphi * sphi
391  vcos(4) = vcos(3)*cphi - vsin(3)*sphi
392  vsin(4) = vcos(3)*sphi + vsin(3)*cphi
393  return
394  ! p >= 4
395  case default
396  vcos(1) = one
397  vsin(1) = zero
398  vcos(2) = cphi
399  vsin(2) = sphi
400  vcos(3) = cphi**2 - sphi**2
401  vsin(3) = 2 * cphi * sphi
402  vcos(4) = vcos(3)*cphi - vsin(3)*sphi
403  vsin(4) = vcos(3)*sphi + vsin(3)*cphi
404  vcos(5) = vcos(3)**2 - vsin(3)**2
405  vsin(5) = 2 * vcos(3) * vsin(3)
406  c4phi = vcos(5)
407  s4phi = vsin(5)
408  end select
409  ! Define cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) recurrently 4 values at a time
410  do m = 6, p-2, 4
411  vcos(m:m+3) = vcos(m-4:m-1)*c4phi - vsin(m-4:m-1)*s4phi
412  vsin(m:m+3) = vcos(m-4:m-1)*s4phi + vsin(m-4:m-1)*c4phi
413  end do
414  ! Work with leftover
415  select case(m-p)
416  case (-1)
417  vcos(p-1) = vcos(p-2)*cphi - vsin(p-2)*sphi
418  vsin(p-1) = vcos(p-2)*sphi + vsin(p-2)*cphi
419  vcos(p) = vcos(p-2)*vcos(3) - vsin(p-2)*vsin(3)
420  vsin(p) = vcos(p-2)*vsin(3) + vsin(p-2)*vcos(3)
421  vcos(p+1) = vcos(p-2)*vcos(4) - vsin(p-2)*vsin(4)
422  vsin(p+1) = vcos(p-2)*vsin(4) + vsin(p-2)*vcos(4)
423  case (0)
424  vcos(p) = vcos(p-1)*cphi - vsin(p-1)*sphi
425  vsin(p) = vcos(p-1)*sphi + vsin(p-1)*cphi
426  vcos(p+1) = vcos(p-1)*vcos(3) - vsin(p-1)*vsin(3)
427  vsin(p+1) = vcos(p-1)*vsin(3) + vsin(p-1)*vcos(3)
428  case (1)
429  vcos(p+1) = vcos(p)*cphi - vsin(p)*sphi
430  vsin(p+1) = vcos(p)*sphi + vsin(p)*cphi
431  end select
432 end subroutine trgev
433 
452 subroutine polleg(ctheta, stheta, p, vplm)
453  ! Inputs
454  integer, intent(in) :: p
455  real(dp), intent(in) :: ctheta, stheta
456  ! Outputs
457  real(dp), intent(out) :: vplm((p+1)**2)
458  ! Temporary workspace
459  real(dp) :: work(p+1)
460  ! Call corresponding work routine
461  call polleg_work(ctheta, stheta, p, vplm, work)
462 end subroutine polleg
463 
482 subroutine polleg_work(ctheta, stheta, p, vplm, work)
483  ! Inputs
484  integer, intent(in) :: p
485  real(dp), intent(in) :: ctheta, stheta
486  ! Outputs
487  real(dp), intent(out) :: vplm((p+1)**2)
488  ! Temporary workspace
489  real(dp), intent(out) :: work(p+1)
490  ! Local variables
491  integer :: m, l, indlm1, indlm2, indl
492  real(dp) :: tmp, tmp1, tmp2, tmp3, tmp4, tmp5, fl, pl2m, pl1m, plm, pmm
493  ! Easy cases
494  select case (p)
495  case (0)
496  vplm(1) = one
497  return
498  case (1)
499  vplm(1) = one
500  vplm(3) = ctheta
501  vplm(4) = -stheta
502  return
503  case (2)
504  vplm(1) = one
505  vplm(3) = ctheta
506  vplm(4) = -stheta
507  tmp1 = three * stheta
508  tmp2 = ctheta * ctheta
509  vplm(7) = 1.5d0*tmp2 - pt5
510  vplm(8) = -tmp1 * ctheta
511  vplm(9) = tmp1 * stheta
512  return
513  case (3)
514  vplm(1) = one
515  vplm(3) = ctheta
516  vplm(4) = -stheta
517  tmp1 = three * stheta
518  tmp2 = ctheta * ctheta
519  vplm(7) = 1.5d0*tmp2 - pt5
520  vplm(8) = -tmp1 * ctheta
521  vplm(9) = tmp1 * stheta
522  tmp3 = 2.5d0 * tmp2 - pt5
523  vplm(13) = tmp3*ctheta - ctheta
524  vplm(14) = -tmp1 * tmp3
525  tmp4 = -5d0 * stheta
526  vplm(15) = tmp4 * vplm(8)
527  vplm(16) = tmp4 * vplm(9)
528  return
529  end select
530  ! Now p >= 4
531  ! Precompute temporary values
532  do l = 1, p
533  work(l) = dble(2*l-1) * ctheta
534  end do
535  ! Save P_m^m for the inital loop m=0 which is P_0^0 now
536  pmm = one
537  ! Case m < p
538  do m = 0, p-1
539  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
540  pl2m = pmm
541  ! P_m^m
542  vplm((m+1)**2) = pmm
543  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
544  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
545  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
546  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
547  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
548  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
549  ! P_{m+1}^m
550  vplm((m+1)*(m+3)) = pl1m
551  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
552  do l = m+2, p
553  plm = work(l)*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
554  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
555  vplm(l*l+l+1+m) = plm
556  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
557  pl2m = pl1m
558  pl1m = plm
559  end do
560  end do
561  ! Case m=p requires only to store P_m^m
562  vplm((p+1)**2) = pmm
563 end subroutine polleg_work
564 
565 !
566 ! Subroutine to compute the Modified Spherical Bessel function of the first kind
567 ! @param[in] lmax : Data type
568 ! @param[in] argument : Argument of Bessel function
569 ! @param[out] SI : Modified Bessel function of the first kind
570 ! @param[out] DI : Derivative of modified Bessel function of the first kind
571 subroutine modified_spherical_bessel_first_kind(lmax, argument, SI, DI, work)
572  use complex_bessel
573  !! Inputs
574  integer, intent(in) :: lmax
575  real(dp), intent(in) :: argument
576  !! Outputs
577  real(dp), dimension(0:lmax), intent(out) :: SI, DI
578  !! Temporary workspace
579  complex(dp), dimension(0:max(1, lmax)), intent(out) :: work
580  !! Local Variables
581  ! Complex_SI : Modified Bessel functions of the first kind
582  ! argument : Argument for Complex_SI
583  ! scaling_factor : sqrt(pi/2x)
584  ! fnu : Starting argument for I_J(x)
585  ! NZ : Number of components set to zero due to underflow
586  ! ierr : Erro indicator for I_J(x)
587  ! l : l=0,...,lmax
588  complex(dp) :: complex_argument
589  real(dp) :: scaling_factor
590  real(dp), parameter :: fnu = 1.5d0
591  integer :: NZ, ierr, l
592  ! If argument is zero then SI is e_1, need to find what is the value of DI
593  if (argument .eq. zero) then
594  si = zero
595  si(0) = one
596  di = zero ! ???
597  return
598  end if
599  ! Compute I_(0.5+J) for J:1,...,lmax
600  ! NOTE: cbesi computes I_(FNU+J-1)
601  !fnu = 1.5
602  scaling_factor = sqrt(pi/(2*argument))
603  ! NOTE: Complex argument is required to call I_J(x)
604  complex_argument = argument
605  ! Compute for l = 0
606  call cbesi(complex_argument, pt5, 1, 1, work(0), nz, ierr)
607  if (ierr .ne. 0) stop 'Error in computing Bessel function of first kind'
608  ! Compute for l = 1,...,lmax
609  if (lmax .gt. 0) then
610  call cbesi(complex_argument, fnu, 1, lmax, work(1:lmax), nz, ierr)
611  if (ierr .ne. 0) stop 'Error in computing Bessel function of first kind'
612  ! l=1 is needed for DI(0)
613  else
614  call cbesi(complex_argument, fnu, 1, 1, work(1), nz, ierr)
615  if (ierr .ne. 0) stop 'Error in computing Bessel function of first kind'
616  end if
617  ! Store the real part of the complex Bessel functions
618  si = real(work(0:lmax))
619  ! Converting Modified Bessel to Spherical Modified Bessel
620  si = scaling_factor * si
621  ! Computation of Derivatives of SI
622  di(0) = scaling_factor * real(work(1))
623  do l = 1, lmax
624  di(l)= si(l-1) - ((l+1.0d0)*si(l))/argument
625  end do
626 end subroutine modified_spherical_bessel_first_kind
627 
628 !
629 ! Subroutine to compute the Modified Spherical Bessel function of the second kind
630 ! @param[in] lmax : Size
631 ! @param[in] argument : Argument of Bessel function
632 ! @param[out] SK : Modified Bessel function of the second kind
633 ! @param[out] DK : Derivative of modified Bessel function of the second kind
634 subroutine modified_spherical_bessel_second_kind(lmax, argument, SK, DK, work)
635  use complex_bessel
636  !! Inputs
637  integer , intent(in) :: lmax
638  real(dp), intent(in) :: argument
639  !! Outputs
640  real(dp), dimension(0:lmax), intent(out) :: SK, DK
641  !! Temporary workspace
642  complex(dp), dimension(0:max(1, lmax)), intent(out) :: work
643  ! Local Variables
644  ! Complex_SK : Modified Bessel functions of the second kind
645  ! argument : Argument for Complex_SK
646  ! scaling_factor : sqrt(pi/2x)
647  ! fnu : Starting argument for K_J(x)
648  ! NZ : Number of components set to zero due to underflow
649  ! ierr : Error indicator for K_J(x)
650  ! l : l=0,...,lmax
651  complex(dp) :: complex_argument
652  real(dp) :: scaling_factor
653  real(dp), parameter :: fnu=1.5d0
654  integer :: NZ, ierr, l
655  ! Compute K_(0.5+J) for J:1,...,lmax
656  ! NOTE: cbesk computes K_(FNU+J-1)
657  scaling_factor = sqrt(2/(pi*argument))
658  ! NOTE: Complex argument is required to call K_J(x)
659  complex_argument = argument
660  ! Compute for l = 0
661  call cbesk(complex_argument, pt5, 1, 1, work(0), nz, ierr)
662  if (ierr .ne. 0) stop 'Error in computing Bessel function of second kind'
663  ! Compute for l = 1,...,lmax
664  if (lmax .gt. 0) then
665  call cbesk(complex_argument, fnu, 1, lmax, work(1:lmax), nz, ierr)
666  if (ierr .ne. 0) stop 'Error in computing Bessel function of second kind'
667  ! l=1 is needed for DK(0)
668  else
669  call cbesk(complex_argument, fnu, 1, 1, work(1), nz, ierr)
670  if (ierr .ne. 0) stop 'Error in computing Bessel function of second kind'
671  end if
672  ! Store the real part of the complex Bessel functions
673  sk = real(work(0:lmax))
674  ! Converting Modified Bessel to Spherical Modified Bessel
675  sk = scaling_factor * sk
676  ! Computation of Derivatives of SK
677  dk(0) = -scaling_factor * real(work(1))
678  do l = 1, lmax
679  dk(l) = -sk(l-1) - ((l+1.0d0)*sk(l))/argument
680  end do
681 end subroutine modified_spherical_bessel_second_kind
682 
709 subroutine fmm_p2m(c, src_q, dst_r, p, vscales, beta, dst_m)
710  ! Inputs
711  integer, intent(in) :: p
712  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_q, dst_r, vscales((p+1)**2), beta
713  ! Output
714  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_m((p+1)**2)
715  ! Workspace
716  real(dp) :: work(2*(p+1)*(p+2))
717  ! Call corresponding work routine
718  call fmm_p2m_work(c, src_q, dst_r, p, vscales, beta, dst_m, work)
719 end subroutine fmm_p2m
720 
748 subroutine fmm_p2m_work(c, src_q, dst_r, p, vscales, beta, dst_m, work)
749  ! Inputs
750  integer, intent(in) :: p
751  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_q, dst_r, vscales((p+1)**2), beta
752  ! Output
753  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_m((p+1)**2)
754  ! Workspace
755  real(dp), intent(out), target :: work(2*(p+1)*(p+2))
756  ! Local variables
757  real(dp) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, t, rcoef
758  integer :: n, ind, vylm1, vylm2, vplm1, vplm2, vcos1, vcos2, vsin1, vsin2
759  ! In case src_q is zero just scale output properly
760  if (src_q .eq. zero) then
761  ! Zero init output if beta is also zero
762  if (beta .eq. zero) then
763  dst_m = zero
764  ! Scale output by beta otherwise
765  else
766  dst_m = beta * dst_m
767  end if
768  ! Exit subroutine
769  return
770  end if
771  ! Now src_q is non-zero
772  ! Mark first and last elements of all work subarrays
773  vylm1 = 1
774  vylm2 = (p+1)**2
775  vplm1 = vylm2 + 1
776  vplm2 = 2 * vylm2
777  vcos1 = vplm2 + 1
778  vcos2 = vcos1 + p
779  vsin1 = vcos2 + 1
780  vsin2 = vsin1 + p
781  ! Get radius and values of spherical harmonics
782  call ylmbas(c, rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, p, vscales, &
783  & work(vylm1:vylm2), work(vplm1:vplm2), work(vcos1:vcos2), &
784  & work(vsin1:vsin2))
785  ! Harmonics are available only if rho > 0
786  if (rho .ne. zero) then
787  rcoef = rho / dst_r
788  t = src_q / dst_r
789  ! Ignore input `dst_m` in case of a zero scaling factor beta
790  if (beta .eq. zero) then
791  do n = 0, p
792  ind = n*n + n + 1
793  ! Array vylm is in the beginning of work array
794  dst_m(ind-n:ind+n) = t * work(ind-n:ind+n)
795  t = t * rcoef
796  end do
797  ! Update `dst_m` otherwise
798  else
799  do n = 0, p
800  ind = n*n + n + 1
801  ! Array vylm is in the beginning of work array
802  dst_m(ind-n:ind+n) = beta*dst_m(ind-n:ind+n) + &
803  & t*work(ind-n:ind+n)
804  t = t * rcoef
805  end do
806  end if
807  ! Naive case of rho = 0
808  else
809  ! Ignore input `dst_m` in case of a zero scaling factor beta
810  if (beta .eq. zero) then
811  dst_m(1) = src_q / dst_r / sqrt4pi
812  dst_m(2:) = zero
813  ! Update `m` otherwise
814  else
815  dst_m(1) = beta*dst_m(1) + src_q/dst_r/sqrt4pi
816  dst_m(2:) = beta * dst_m(2:)
817  end if
818  end if
819 end subroutine fmm_p2m_work
820 
847 subroutine fmm_m2p(c, src_r, p, vscales_rel, alpha, src_m, beta, dst_v)
848  ! Inputs
849  integer, intent(in) :: p
850  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_r, vscales_rel((p+1)*(p+1)), alpha, &
851  & src_m((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
852  ! Output
853  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_v
854  ! Temporary workspace
855  real(dp) :: work(p+1)
856  ! Call corresponding work routine
857  call fmm_m2p_work(c, src_r, p, vscales_rel, alpha, src_m, beta, dst_v, &
858  & work)
859 end subroutine fmm_m2p
860 
890 subroutine fmm_m2p_work(c, src_r, p, vscales_rel, alpha, src_m, &
891  & beta, dst_v, work)
892  ! Inputs
893  integer, intent(in) :: p
894  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_r, vscales_rel((p+1)*(p+1)), alpha, &
895  & src_m((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
896  ! Output
897  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_v
898  ! Workspace
899  real(dp), intent(out), target :: work(p+1)
900  ! Local variables
901  real(dp) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, rcoef, t, tmp, tmp1, tmp2, &
902  & tmp3, fl, max12, ssq12, pl2m, pl1m, plm, pmm, cmphi, smphi, ylm
903  integer :: l, m, indl
904  ! Scale output
905  if (beta .eq. zero) then
906  dst_v = zero
907  else
908  dst_v = beta * dst_v
909  end if
910  ! In case of zero alpha nothing else is required no matter what is the
911  ! value of the induced potential
912  if (alpha .eq. zero) then
913  return
914  end if
915  ! Get spherical coordinates
916  if (c(1) .eq. zero) then
917  max12 = abs(c(2))
918  ssq12 = one
919  else if (abs(c(2)) .gt. abs(c(1))) then
920  max12 = abs(c(2))
921  ssq12 = one + (c(1)/c(2))**2
922  else
923  max12 = abs(c(1))
924  ssq12 = one + (c(2)/c(1))**2
925  end if
926  ! Then we compute rho
927  if (c(3) .eq. zero) then
928  rho = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
929  else if (abs(c(3)) .gt. max12) then
930  rho = one + ssq12 *(max12/c(3))**2
931  rho = abs(c(3)) * sqrt(rho)
932  else
933  rho = ssq12 + (c(3)/max12)**2
934  rho = max12 * sqrt(rho)
935  end if
936  ! In case of a singularity (rho=zero) induced potential is infinite and is
937  ! not taken into account.
938  if (rho .eq. zero) then
939  return
940  end if
941  ! Compute the actual induced potential
942  rcoef = src_r / rho
943  ! Length of a vector x(1:2)
944  stheta = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
945  ! Case x(1:2) != 0
946  if (stheta .ne. zero) then
947  ! Normalize cphi and sphi
948  cphi = c(1) / stheta
949  sphi = c(2) / stheta
950  ! Normalize ctheta and stheta
951  ctheta = c(3) / rho
952  stheta = stheta / rho
953  ! Treat easy cases
954  select case(p)
955  case (0)
956  ! l = 0
957  dst_v = dst_v + alpha*rcoef*vscales_rel(1)*src_m(1)
958  return
959  case (1)
960  ! l = 0
961  tmp = src_m(1) * vscales_rel(1)
962  ! l = 1
963  tmp2 = ctheta * src_m(3) * vscales_rel(3)
964  tmp3 = vscales_rel(4) * stheta
965  tmp2 = tmp2 - tmp3*sphi*src_m(2)
966  tmp2 = tmp2 - tmp3*cphi*src_m(4)
967  dst_v = dst_v + alpha*rcoef*(tmp+rcoef*tmp2)
968  return
969  end select
970  ! Now p>1
971  ! Precompute alpha*rcoef^{l+1}
972  work(1) = alpha * rcoef
973  do l = 1, p
974  work(l+1) = rcoef * work(l)
975  end do
976  ! Case m = 0
977  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
978  pl2m = one
979  dst_v = dst_v + work(1)*src_m(1)*vscales_rel(1)
980  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
981  pmm = -stheta
982  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
983  pl1m = ctheta
984  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel(3)
985  dst_v = dst_v + work(2)*src_m(3)*ylm
986  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
987  do l = 2, p
988  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
989  plm = plm / dble(l)
990  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1)
991  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*src_m(l*l+l+1)*ylm
992  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
993  pl2m = pl1m
994  pl1m = plm
995  end do
996  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
997  cmphi = cphi
998  smphi = sphi
999  ! Case 0<m<p
1000  do m = 1, p-1
1001  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
1002  pl2m = pmm
1003  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((m+1)**2)
1004  tmp1 = cmphi*src_m((m+1)**2) + smphi*src_m(m*m+1)
1005  dst_v = dst_v + work(m+1)*ylm*tmp1
1006  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
1007  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
1008  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1009  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
1010  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1011  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
1012  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel((m+1)*(m+3))
1013  tmp1 = cmphi*src_m((m+1)*(m+3)) + smphi*src_m((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m)
1014  dst_v = dst_v + work(m+2)*ylm*tmp1
1015  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1016  do l = m+2, p
1017  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
1018  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
1019  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1+m)
1020  tmp1 = cmphi*src_m(l*l+l+1+m) + smphi*src_m(l*l+l+1-m)
1021  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*ylm*tmp1
1022  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1023  pl2m = pl1m
1024  pl1m = plm
1025  end do
1026  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
1027  tmp1 = cmphi
1028  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
1029  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
1030  end do
1031  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
1032  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((p+1)**2)
1033  tmp1 = cmphi*src_m((p+1)**2) + smphi*src_m(p*p+1)
1034  dst_v = dst_v + work(p+1)*ylm*tmp1
1035  ! Case of x(1:2) = 0 and x(3) != 0
1036  else
1037  ! In this case Y_l^m = 0 for m != 0, so only case m = 0 is taken into
1038  ! account. Y_l^0 = ctheta^l in this case where ctheta is either +1 or
1039  ! -1. So, we copy sign(ctheta) into rcoef. But before that we
1040  ! initialize alpha/r factor for l=0 case without taking possible sign
1041  ! into account.
1042  t = alpha * rcoef
1043  if (c(3) .lt. zero) then
1044  rcoef = -rcoef
1045  end if
1046  ! Proceed with accumulation of a potential
1047  indl = 1
1048  do l = 0, p
1049  ! Index of Y_l^0
1050  indl = indl + 2*l
1051  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
1052  dst_v = dst_v + t*src_m(indl)*vscales_rel(indl)
1053  ! Update t
1054  t = t * rcoef
1055  end do
1056  end if
1057 end subroutine fmm_m2p_work
1058 
1085 subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel(c, src_r, p, vscales, alpha, src_m, beta, dst_v)
1086  use complex_bessel
1087  ! Inputs
1088  integer, intent(in) :: p
1089  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_r, vscales((p+1)*(p+1)), alpha, &
1090  & src_m((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
1091  ! Output
1092  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_v
1093  ! Temporary workspace
1094  complex(dp) :: work_complex(max(2, p+1))
1095  real(dp) :: work(p+1)
1096  ! Local variables
1097  real(dp) :: src_sk(p+1)
1098  ! Call corresponding work routine
1099  call modified_spherical_bessel_second_kind(p, src_r, src_sk, work, &
1100  & work_complex)
1101  call fmm_m2p_bessel_work(c, p, vscales, src_sk, alpha, src_m, beta, &
1102  & dst_v, work_complex, work)
1103 end subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel
1104 
1131 subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel_work(c, p, vscales, SK_ri, alpha, src_m, beta, &
1132  & dst_v, work_complex, work)
1133  use complex_bessel
1134  !! Inputs
1135  integer, intent(in) :: p
1136  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), vscales((p+1)*(p+1)), alpha, &
1137  & src_m((p+1)*(p+1)), beta, SK_ri(p+1)
1138  !! Output
1139  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_v
1140  !! Workspace
1141  complex(dp), intent(out) :: work_complex(p+1)
1142  real(dp), intent(out) :: work(p+1)
1143  !! Local variables
1144  real(dp) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, tmp, tmp1, tmp2, &
1145  & tmp3, fl, max12, ssq12, pl2m, pl1m, plm, pmm, cmphi, smphi, ylm, t
1146  real(dp) :: scaling_factor
1147  complex(dp) :: complex_argument
1148  integer :: l, m, indl, ierr, NZ
1149  real(dp), parameter :: fnu=1.5d0
1150  ! Scale output
1151  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1152  dst_v = zero
1153  else
1154  dst_v = beta * dst_v
1155  end if
1156  ! In case of zero alpha nothing else is required no matter what is the
1157  ! value of the induced potential
1158  if (alpha .eq. zero) then
1159  return
1160  end if
1161  ! Get spherical coordinates
1162  if (c(1) .eq. zero) then
1163  max12 = abs(c(2))
1164  ssq12 = one
1165  else if (abs(c(2)) .gt. abs(c(1))) then
1166  max12 = abs(c(2))
1167  ssq12 = one + (c(1)/c(2))**2
1168  else
1169  max12 = abs(c(1))
1170  ssq12 = one + (c(2)/c(1))**2
1171  end if
1172  ! Then we compute rho
1173  if (c(3) .eq. zero) then
1174  rho = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
1175  else if (abs(c(3)) .gt. max12) then
1176  rho = one + ssq12 *(max12/c(3))**2
1177  rho = abs(c(3)) * sqrt(rho)
1178  else
1179  rho = ssq12 + (c(3)/max12)**2
1180  rho = max12 * sqrt(rho)
1181  end if
1182  ! In case of a singularity (rho=zero) induced potential is infinite and is
1183  ! not taken into account.
1184  if (rho .eq. zero) then
1185  return
1186  end if
1187  ! Compute Bessel function
1188  scaling_factor = alpha * sqrt(two / (pi*rho))
1189  ! NOTE: Complex argument is required to call I_J(x)
1190  complex_argument = rho
1191  ! Compute for l = 0
1192  call cbesk(complex_argument, pt5, 1, 1, work_complex(1), nz, ierr)
1193  ! Compute for l = 1,...,p
1194  if (p .gt. 0) then
1195  call cbesk(complex_argument, fnu, 1, p, work_complex(2:p+1), nz, ierr)
1196  end if
1197  work = scaling_factor * real(work_complex) / sk_ri
1198  ! Compute the actual induced potential
1199  ! Length of a vector x(1:2)
1200  stheta = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
1201  ! Case x(1:2) != 0
1202  if (stheta .ne. zero) then
1203  ! Normalize cphi and sphi
1204  cphi = c(1) / stheta
1205  sphi = c(2) / stheta
1206  ! Normalize ctheta and stheta
1207  ctheta = c(3) / rho
1208  stheta = stheta / rho
1209  ! Treat easy cases
1210  select case(p)
1211  case (0)
1212  ! l = 0
1213  dst_v = dst_v + work(1)*vscales(1)*src_m(1)
1214  return
1215  case (1)
1216  ! l = 0
1217  tmp = work(1) * src_m(1) * vscales(1)
1218  ! l = 1
1219  tmp2 = ctheta * src_m(3) * vscales(3)
1220  tmp3 = stheta * vscales(4)
1221  tmp2 = tmp2 - tmp3*sphi*src_m(2)
1222  tmp2 = tmp2 - tmp3*cphi*src_m(4)
1223  dst_v = dst_v + tmp + work(2)*tmp2
1224  return
1225  end select
1226  ! Now p>1
1227  ! Case m = 0
1228  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
1229  pl2m = one
1230  dst_v = dst_v + work(1)*src_m(1)*vscales(1)
1231  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1232  pmm = -stheta
1233  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1234  pl1m = ctheta
1235  ylm = pl1m * vscales(3)
1236  dst_v = dst_v + work(2)*src_m(3)*ylm
1237  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1238  do l = 2, p
1239  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
1240  plm = plm / dble(l)
1241  ylm = plm * vscales(l*l+l+1)
1242  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*src_m(l*l+l+1)*ylm
1243  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1244  pl2m = pl1m
1245  pl1m = plm
1246  end do
1247  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
1248  cmphi = cphi
1249  smphi = sphi
1250  ! Case 0<m<p
1251  do m = 1, p-1
1252  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
1253  pl2m = pmm
1254  ylm = pmm * vscales((m+1)**2)
1255  tmp1 = cmphi*src_m((m+1)**2) + smphi*src_m(m*m+1)
1256  dst_v = dst_v + work(m+1)*ylm*tmp1
1257  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
1258  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
1259  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1260  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
1261  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1262  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
1263  ylm = pl1m * vscales((m+1)*(m+3))
1264  tmp1 = cmphi*src_m((m+1)*(m+3)) + smphi*src_m((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m)
1265  dst_v = dst_v + work(m+2)*ylm*tmp1
1266  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1267  do l = m+2, p
1268  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
1269  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
1270  ylm = plm * vscales(l*l+l+1+m)
1271  tmp1 = cmphi*src_m(l*l+l+1+m) + smphi*src_m(l*l+l+1-m)
1272  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*ylm*tmp1
1273  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1274  pl2m = pl1m
1275  pl1m = plm
1276  end do
1277  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
1278  tmp1 = cmphi
1279  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
1280  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
1281  end do
1282  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
1283  ylm = pmm * vscales((p+1)**2)
1284  tmp1 = cmphi*src_m((p+1)**2) + smphi*src_m(p*p+1)
1285  dst_v = dst_v + work(p+1)*ylm*tmp1
1286  ! Case of x(1:2) = 0 and x(3) != 0
1287  else
1288  ! In this case Y_l^m = 0 for m != 0, so only case m = 0 is taken into
1289  ! account. Y_l^0 = ctheta^l in this case where ctheta is either +1 or
1290  ! -1. So, we copy sign(ctheta) into rcoef. But before that we
1291  ! initialize alpha/r factor for l=0 case without taking possible sign
1292  ! into account.
1293  t = one
1294  if (c(3) .lt. zero) then
1295  ! Proceed with accumulation of a potential
1296  indl = 1
1297  do l = 0, p
1298  ! Index of Y_l^0
1299  indl = indl + 2*l
1300  ! Y_l^0 contribution
1301  dst_v = dst_v + t*work(l+1)*src_m(indl)*vscales(indl)
1302  t = -t
1303  end do
1304  else
1305  ! Proceed with accumulation of a potential
1306  indl = 1
1307  do l = 0, p
1308  ! Index of Y_l^0
1309  indl = indl + 2*l
1310  ! Y_l^0 contribution
1311  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*src_m(indl)*vscales(indl)
1312  end do
1313  end if
1314  end if
1315 end subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel_work
1316 
1317 subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel_grad(c, src_r, p, vscales, alpha, src_m, beta, dst_g)
1318  use complex_bessel
1319  ! Inputs
1320  integer, intent(in) :: p
1321  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_r, vscales((p+2)*(p+2)), alpha, &
1322  & src_m((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
1323  ! Output
1324  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_g(3)
1325  ! Temporary workspace
1326  complex(dp) :: work_complex(p+2)
1327  real(dp) :: work(p+2), src_sk(p+2), vcnk(1), src_m_grad((p+2)**2, 3)
1328  ! Call corresponding work routine
1329  call modified_spherical_bessel_second_kind(p+1, src_r, src_sk, work, &
1330  & work_complex)
1331  call fmm_m2m_bessel_grad(p, src_sk, vscales, vcnk, src_m, src_m_grad)
1332  call fmm_m2p_bessel_work(c, p+1, vscales, src_sk, -alpha, src_m_grad(:, 1), &
1333  & beta, dst_g(1), work_complex, work)
1334  call fmm_m2p_bessel_work(c, p+1, vscales, src_sk, -alpha, src_m_grad(:, 2), &
1335  & beta, dst_g(2), work_complex, work)
1336  call fmm_m2p_bessel_work(c, p+1, vscales, src_sk, -alpha, src_m_grad(:, 3), &
1337  & beta, dst_g(3), work_complex, work)
1338 end subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel_grad
1339 
1365 subroutine fmm_m2p_adj(c, src_q, dst_r, p, vscales_rel, beta, dst_m)
1366  ! Inputs
1367  integer, intent(in) :: p
1368  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_q, dst_r, vscales_rel((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
1369  ! Output
1370  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_m((p+1)**2)
1371  ! Workspace
1372  real(dp) :: work(p+1)
1373  ! Call corresponding work routine
1374  call fmm_m2p_adj_work(c, src_q, dst_r, p, vscales_rel, beta, dst_m, work)
1375 end subroutine fmm_m2p_adj
1376 
1403 subroutine fmm_m2p_adj_work(c, src_q, dst_r, p, vscales_rel, beta, dst_m, work)
1404  ! Inputs
1405  integer, intent(in) :: p
1406  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_q, dst_r, vscales_rel((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
1407  ! Output
1408  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_m((p+1)**2)
1409  ! Workspace
1410  real(dp), intent(out), target :: work(p+1)
1411  ! Local variables
1412  real(dp) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, rcoef, t, tmp, tmp1, tmp2, &
1413  & tmp3, fl, max12, ssq12, pl2m, pl1m, plm, pmm, cmphi, smphi, ylm
1414  integer :: l, m, indl
1415  ! In case src_q is zero just scale output properly
1416  if (src_q .eq. zero) then
1417  ! Zero init output if beta is also zero
1418  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1419  dst_m = zero
1420  ! Scale output by beta otherwise
1421  else
1422  dst_m = beta * dst_m
1423  end if
1424  ! Exit subroutine
1425  return
1426  end if
1427  ! Now src_q is non-zero
1428  ! Get spherical coordinates
1429  if (c(1) .eq. zero) then
1430  max12 = abs(c(2))
1431  ssq12 = one
1432  else if (abs(c(2)) .gt. abs(c(1))) then
1433  max12 = abs(c(2))
1434  ssq12 = one + (c(1)/c(2))**2
1435  else
1436  max12 = abs(c(1))
1437  ssq12 = one + (c(2)/c(1))**2
1438  end if
1439  ! Then we compute rho
1440  if (c(3) .eq. zero) then
1441  rho = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
1442  else if (abs(c(3)) .gt. max12) then
1443  rho = one + ssq12 *(max12/c(3))**2
1444  rho = abs(c(3)) * sqrt(rho)
1445  else
1446  rho = ssq12 + (c(3)/max12)**2
1447  rho = max12 * sqrt(rho)
1448  end if
1449  ! In case of a singularity (rho=zero) induced potential is infinite and is
1450  ! not taken into account.
1451  if (rho .eq. zero) then
1452  return
1453  end if
1454  ! Compute actual induced potentials
1455  rcoef = dst_r / rho
1456  ! Length of a vector x(1:2)
1457  stheta = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
1458  ! Case x(1:2) != 0
1459  if (stheta .ne. zero) then
1460  ! Normalize cphi and sphi
1461  cphi = c(1) / stheta
1462  sphi = c(2) / stheta
1463  ! Normalize ctheta and stheta
1464  ctheta = c(3) / rho
1465  stheta = stheta / rho
1466  ! Treat easy cases
1467  t = src_q * rcoef
1468  select case(p)
1469  case (0)
1470  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1471  dst_m(1) = t * vscales_rel(1)
1472  else
1473  dst_m(1) = beta*dst_m(1) + t*vscales_rel(1)
1474  end if
1475  return
1476  case (1)
1477  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1478  ! l = 0
1479  dst_m(1) = t * vscales_rel(1)
1480  ! l = 1
1481  t = t * rcoef
1482  tmp = -vscales_rel(4) * stheta
1483  tmp2 = t * tmp
1484  dst_m(2) = tmp2 * sphi
1485  dst_m(3) = t * vscales_rel(3) * ctheta
1486  dst_m(4) = tmp2 * cphi
1487  else
1488  ! l = 0
1489  dst_m(1) = beta*dst_m(1) + t*vscales_rel(1)
1490  ! l = 1
1491  t = t * rcoef
1492  tmp = -vscales_rel(4) * stheta
1493  tmp2 = t * tmp
1494  dst_m(2) = beta*dst_m(2) + tmp2*sphi
1495  dst_m(3) = beta*dst_m(3) + t*vscales_rel(3)*ctheta
1496  dst_m(4) = beta*dst_m(4) + tmp2*cphi
1497  end if
1498  return
1499  end select
1500  ! Now p>1
1501  ! Precompute src_q*rcoef^{l+1}
1502  work(1) = src_q * rcoef
1503  do l = 1, p
1504  work(l+1) = rcoef * work(l)
1505  end do
1506  ! Overwrite output
1507  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1508  ! Case m = 0
1509  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
1510  pl2m = one
1511  dst_m(1) = work(1) * vscales_rel(1)
1512  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1513  pmm = -stheta
1514  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1515  pl1m = ctheta
1516  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel(3)
1517  dst_m(3) = work(2) * ylm
1518  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1519  do l = 2, p
1520  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
1521  plm = plm / dble(l)
1522  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1)
1523  dst_m(l*l+l+1) = work(l+1) * ylm
1524  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1525  pl2m = pl1m
1526  pl1m = plm
1527  end do
1528  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
1529  cmphi = cphi
1530  smphi = sphi
1531  ! Case 0<m<p
1532  do m = 1, p-1
1533  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
1534  pl2m = pmm
1535  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((m+1)**2)
1536  ylm = work(m+1) * ylm
1537  dst_m((m+1)**2) = cmphi * ylm
1538  dst_m(m*m+1) = smphi * ylm
1539  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
1540  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
1541  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1542  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
1543  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1544  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
1545  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel((m+1)*(m+3))
1546  ylm = work(m+2) * ylm
1547  dst_m((m+1)*(m+3)) = cmphi * ylm
1548  dst_m((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m) = smphi * ylm
1549  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1550  do l = m+2, p
1551  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
1552  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
1553  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1+m)
1554  ylm = work(l+1) * ylm
1555  dst_m(l*l+l+1+m) = cmphi * ylm
1556  dst_m(l*l+l+1-m) = smphi * ylm
1557  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1558  pl2m = pl1m
1559  pl1m = plm
1560  end do
1561  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
1562  tmp1 = cmphi
1563  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
1564  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
1565  end do
1566  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
1567  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((p+1)**2)
1568  ylm = work(p+1) * ylm
1569  dst_m((p+1)**2) = cmphi * ylm
1570  dst_m(p*p+1) = smphi * ylm
1571  ! Update output
1572  else
1573  ! Case m = 0
1574  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
1575  pl2m = one
1576  dst_m(1) = beta*dst_m(1) + work(1)*vscales_rel(1)
1577  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1578  pmm = -stheta
1579  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1580  pl1m = ctheta
1581  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel(3)
1582  dst_m(3) = beta*dst_m(3) + work(2)*ylm
1583  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1584  do l = 2, p
1585  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
1586  plm = plm / dble(l)
1587  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1)
1588  dst_m(l*l+l+1) = beta*dst_m(l*l+l+1) + work(l+1)*ylm
1589  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1590  pl2m = pl1m
1591  pl1m = plm
1592  end do
1593  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
1594  cmphi = cphi
1595  smphi = sphi
1596  ! Case 0<m<p
1597  do m = 1, p-1
1598  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
1599  pl2m = pmm
1600  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((m+1)**2)
1601  ylm = work(m+1) * ylm
1602  dst_m((m+1)**2) = beta*dst_m((m+1)**2) + cmphi*ylm
1603  dst_m(m*m+1) = beta*dst_m(m*m+1) + smphi*ylm
1604  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
1605  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
1606  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1607  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
1608  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1609  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
1610  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel((m+1)*(m+3))
1611  ylm = work(m+2) * ylm
1612  dst_m((m+1)*(m+3)) = beta*dst_m((m+1)*(m+3)) + cmphi*ylm
1613  dst_m((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m) = beta*dst_m((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m) + &
1614  & smphi*ylm
1615  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1616  do l = m+2, p
1617  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
1618  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
1619  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1+m)
1620  ylm = work(l+1) * ylm
1621  dst_m(l*l+l+1+m) = beta*dst_m(l*l+l+1+m) + cmphi*ylm
1622  dst_m(l*l+l+1-m) = beta*dst_m(l*l+l+1-m) + smphi*ylm
1623  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1624  pl2m = pl1m
1625  pl1m = plm
1626  end do
1627  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
1628  tmp1 = cmphi
1629  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
1630  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
1631  end do
1632  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
1633  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((p+1)**2)
1634  ylm = work(p+1) * ylm
1635  dst_m((p+1)**2) = beta*dst_m((p+1)**2) + cmphi*ylm
1636  dst_m(p*p+1) = beta*dst_m(p*p+1) + smphi*ylm
1637  end if
1638  ! Case of x(1:2) = 0 and x(3) != 0
1639  else
1640  ! In this case Y_l^m = 0 for m != 0, so only case m = 0 is taken into
1641  ! account. Y_l^0 = ctheta^l in this case where ctheta is either +1 or
1642  ! -1. So, we copy sign(ctheta) into rcoef. But before that we
1643  ! initialize alpha/r factor for l=0 case without taking possible sign
1644  ! into account.
1645  t = src_q * rcoef
1646  if (c(3) .lt. zero) then
1647  rcoef = -rcoef
1648  end if
1649  ! Proceed with accumulation of a potential
1650  indl = 1
1651  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1652  do l = 0, p
1653  ! Index of Y_l^0
1654  indl = indl + 2*l
1655  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
1656  dst_m(indl) = t * vscales_rel(indl)
1657  dst_m(indl-l:indl-1) = zero
1658  dst_m(indl+1:indl+l) = zero
1659  ! Update t
1660  t = t * rcoef
1661  end do
1662  else
1663  do l = 0, p
1664  ! Index of Y_l^0
1665  indl = indl + 2*l
1666  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
1667  dst_m(indl) = beta*dst_m(indl) + t*vscales_rel(indl)
1668  dst_m(indl-l:indl-1) = beta * dst_m(indl-l:indl-1)
1669  dst_m(indl+1:indl+l) = beta * dst_m(indl+1:indl+l)
1670  ! Update t
1671  t = t * rcoef
1672  end do
1673  end if
1674  end if
1675 end subroutine fmm_m2p_adj_work
1676 
1702 subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel_adj(c, src_q, dst_r, kappa, p, vscales, beta, dst_m)
1703  ! Inputs
1704  integer, intent(in) :: p
1705  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_q, dst_r, vscales((p+1)*(p+1)), beta, &
1706  & kappa
1707  ! Output
1708  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_m((p+1)**2)
1709  ! Workspace
1710  complex(dp) :: work_complex(max(2, p+1))
1711  real(dp) :: work(p+1)
1712  ! Local variables
1713  real(dp) :: dst_sk(p+1), ck(3)
1714  ! Call corresponding work routine
1715  call modified_spherical_bessel_second_kind(p, kappa*dst_r, dst_sk, work, &
1716  & work_complex)
1717  ck = kappa*c
1718  call fmm_m2p_bessel_adj_work(ck, src_q, dst_sk, p, vscales, beta, &
1719  & dst_m, work_complex, work)
1720 end subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel_adj
1721 
1748 subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel_adj_work(c, src_q, dst_sk, p, vscales, beta, dst_m, &
1749  & work_complex, work)
1750  use complex_bessel
1751  ! Inputs
1752  integer, intent(in) :: p
1753  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_q, dst_sk(p+1), vscales((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
1754  ! Output
1755  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_m((p+1)**2)
1756  ! Workspace
1757  complex(dp), intent(out) :: work_complex(p+1)
1758  real(dp), intent(out) :: work(p+1)
1759  ! Local variables
1760  real(dp) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, rcoef, t, tmp, tmp1, tmp2, &
1761  & tmp3, fl, max12, ssq12, pl2m, pl1m, plm, pmm, cmphi, smphi, ylm, &
1762  & scaling_factor
1763  integer :: l, m, indl, NZ, ierr
1764  complex(dp) :: complex_argument
1765  ! In case src_q is zero just scale output properly
1766  if (src_q .eq. zero) then
1767  ! Zero init output if beta is also zero
1768  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1769  dst_m = zero
1770  ! Scale output by beta otherwise
1771  else
1772  dst_m = beta * dst_m
1773  end if
1774  ! Exit subroutine
1775  return
1776  end if
1777  ! Now src_q is non-zero
1778  ! Get spherical coordinates
1779  if (c(1) .eq. zero) then
1780  max12 = abs(c(2))
1781  ssq12 = one
1782  else if (abs(c(2)) .gt. abs(c(1))) then
1783  max12 = abs(c(2))
1784  ssq12 = one + (c(1)/c(2))**2
1785  else
1786  max12 = abs(c(1))
1787  ssq12 = one + (c(2)/c(1))**2
1788  end if
1789  ! Then we compute rho
1790  if (c(3) .eq. zero) then
1791  rho = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
1792  else if (abs(c(3)) .gt. max12) then
1793  rho = one + ssq12 *(max12/c(3))**2
1794  rho = abs(c(3)) * sqrt(rho)
1795  else
1796  rho = ssq12 + (c(3)/max12)**2
1797  rho = max12 * sqrt(rho)
1798  end if
1799  ! In case of a singularity (rho=zero) induced potential is infinite and is
1800  ! not taken into account.
1801  if (rho .eq. zero) then
1802  return
1803  end if
1804  ! Compute Bessel function
1805  scaling_factor = src_q * sqrt(two / (pi*rho))
1806  ! NOTE: Complex argument is required to call I_J(x)
1807  complex_argument = rho
1808  ! Compute for l = 0
1809  call cbesk(complex_argument, pt5, 1, 1, work_complex(1), nz, ierr)
1810  ! Compute for l = 1,...,p
1811  if (p .gt. 0) then
1812  call cbesk(complex_argument, 1.5d0, 1, p, work_complex(2:p+1), nz, ierr)
1813  end if
1814  work = scaling_factor * real(work_complex) / dst_sk
1815  ! Length of a vector x(1:2)
1816  stheta = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
1817  ! Case x(1:2) != 0
1818  if (stheta .ne. zero) then
1819  ! Normalize cphi and sphi
1820  cphi = c(1) / stheta
1821  sphi = c(2) / stheta
1822  ! Normalize ctheta and stheta
1823  ctheta = c(3) / rho
1824  stheta = stheta / rho
1825  ! Treat easy cases
1826  select case(p)
1827  case (0)
1828  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1829  dst_m(1) = work(1) * vscales(1)
1830  else
1831  dst_m(1) = beta*dst_m(1) + work(1)*vscales(1)
1832  end if
1833  return
1834  case (1)
1835  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1836  ! l = 0
1837  dst_m(1) = work(1) * vscales(1)
1838  ! l = 1
1839  tmp = -vscales(4) * stheta
1840  tmp2 = work(2) * tmp
1841  dst_m(2) = tmp2 * sphi
1842  dst_m(3) = work(2) * vscales(3) * ctheta
1843  dst_m(4) = tmp2 * cphi
1844  else
1845  ! l = 0
1846  dst_m(1) = beta*dst_m(1) + work(1)*vscales(1)
1847  ! l = 1
1848  tmp = -vscales(4) * stheta
1849  tmp2 = work(2) * tmp
1850  dst_m(2) = beta*dst_m(2) + tmp2*sphi
1851  dst_m(3) = beta*dst_m(3) + work(2)*vscales(3)*ctheta
1852  dst_m(4) = beta*dst_m(4) + tmp2*cphi
1853  end if
1854  return
1855  end select
1856  ! Now p>1
1857  ! Overwrite output
1858  if (beta .eq. zero) then
1859  ! Case m = 0
1860  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
1861  pl2m = one
1862  dst_m(1) = work(1) * vscales(1)
1863  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1864  pmm = -stheta
1865  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1866  pl1m = ctheta
1867  ylm = pl1m * vscales(3)
1868  dst_m(3) = work(2) * ylm
1869  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1870  do l = 2, p
1871  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
1872  plm = plm / dble(l)
1873  ylm = plm * vscales(l*l+l+1)
1874  dst_m(l*l+l+1) = work(l+1) * ylm
1875  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1876  pl2m = pl1m
1877  pl1m = plm
1878  end do
1879  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
1880  cmphi = cphi
1881  smphi = sphi
1882  ! Case 0<m<p
1883  do m = 1, p-1
1884  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
1885  pl2m = pmm
1886  ylm = pmm * vscales((m+1)**2)
1887  ylm = work(m+1) * ylm
1888  dst_m((m+1)**2) = cmphi * ylm
1889  dst_m(m*m+1) = smphi * ylm
1890  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
1891  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
1892  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1893  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
1894  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1895  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
1896  ylm = pl1m * vscales((m+1)*(m+3))
1897  ylm = work(m+2) * ylm
1898  dst_m((m+1)*(m+3)) = cmphi * ylm
1899  dst_m((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m) = smphi * ylm
1900  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1901  do l = m+2, p
1902  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
1903  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
1904  ylm = plm * vscales(l*l+l+1+m)
1905  ylm = work(l+1) * ylm
1906  dst_m(l*l+l+1+m) = cmphi * ylm
1907  dst_m(l*l+l+1-m) = smphi * ylm
1908  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1909  pl2m = pl1m
1910  pl1m = plm
1911  end do
1912  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
1913  tmp1 = cmphi
1914  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
1915  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
1916  end do
1917  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
1918  ylm = pmm * vscales((p+1)**2)
1919  ylm = work(p+1) * ylm
1920  dst_m((p+1)**2) = cmphi * ylm
1921  dst_m(p*p+1) = smphi * ylm
1922  ! Update output
1923  else
1924  ! Case m = 0
1925  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
1926  pl2m = one
1927  dst_m(1) = beta*dst_m(1) + work(1)*vscales(1)
1928  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1929  pmm = -stheta
1930  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1931  pl1m = ctheta
1932  ylm = pl1m * vscales(3)
1933  dst_m(3) = beta*dst_m(3) + work(2)*ylm
1934  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1935  do l = 2, p
1936  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
1937  plm = plm / dble(l)
1938  ylm = plm * vscales(l*l+l+1)
1939  dst_m(l*l+l+1) = beta*dst_m(l*l+l+1) + work(l+1)*ylm
1940  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1941  pl2m = pl1m
1942  pl1m = plm
1943  end do
1944  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
1945  cmphi = cphi
1946  smphi = sphi
1947  ! Case 0<m<p
1948  do m = 1, p-1
1949  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
1950  pl2m = pmm
1951  ylm = pmm * vscales((m+1)**2)
1952  ylm = work(m+1) * ylm
1953  dst_m((m+1)**2) = beta*dst_m((m+1)**2) + cmphi*ylm
1954  dst_m(m*m+1) = beta*dst_m(m*m+1) + smphi*ylm
1955  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
1956  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
1957  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
1958  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
1959  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
1960  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
1961  ylm = pl1m * vscales((m+1)*(m+3))
1962  ylm = work(m+2) * ylm
1963  dst_m((m+1)*(m+3)) = beta*dst_m((m+1)*(m+3)) + cmphi*ylm
1964  dst_m((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m) = beta*dst_m((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m) + &
1965  & smphi*ylm
1966  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
1967  do l = m+2, p
1968  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
1969  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
1970  ylm = plm * vscales(l*l+l+1+m)
1971  ylm = work(l+1) * ylm
1972  dst_m(l*l+l+1+m) = beta*dst_m(l*l+l+1+m) + cmphi*ylm
1973  dst_m(l*l+l+1-m) = beta*dst_m(l*l+l+1-m) + smphi*ylm
1974  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
1975  pl2m = pl1m
1976  pl1m = plm
1977  end do
1978  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
1979  tmp1 = cmphi
1980  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
1981  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
1982  end do
1983  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
1984  ylm = pmm * vscales((p+1)**2)
1985  ylm = work(p+1) * ylm
1986  dst_m((p+1)**2) = beta*dst_m((p+1)**2) + cmphi*ylm
1987  dst_m(p*p+1) = beta*dst_m(p*p+1) + smphi*ylm
1988  end if
1989  ! Case of x(1:2) = 0 and x(3) != 0
1990  else
1991  ! In this case Y_l^m = 0 for m != 0, so only case m = 0 is taken into
1992  ! account. Y_l^0 = ctheta^l in this case where ctheta is either +1 or
1993  ! -1. So, we copy sign(ctheta) into rcoef. But before that we
1994  ! initialize alpha/r factor for l=0 case without taking possible sign
1995  ! into account.
1996  t = one
1997  if (c(3) .lt. zero) then
1998  ! Proceed with accumulation of a potential
1999  indl = 1
2000  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2001  do l = 0, p
2002  ! Index of Y_l^0
2003  indl = indl + 2*l
2004  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
2005  dst_m(indl) = t * work(l+1) * vscales(indl)
2006  dst_m(indl-l:indl-1) = zero
2007  dst_m(indl+1:indl+l) = zero
2008  ! Update t
2009  t = -t
2010  end do
2011  else
2012  do l = 0, p
2013  ! Index of Y_l^0
2014  indl = indl + 2*l
2015  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
2016  dst_m(indl) = beta*dst_m(indl) + t*work(l+1)*vscales(indl)
2017  dst_m(indl-l:indl-1) = beta * dst_m(indl-l:indl-1)
2018  dst_m(indl+1:indl+l) = beta * dst_m(indl+1:indl+l)
2019  ! Update t
2020  t = -t
2021  end do
2022  end if
2023  else
2024  ! Proceed with accumulation of a potential
2025  indl = 1
2026  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2027  do l = 0, p
2028  ! Index of Y_l^0
2029  indl = indl + 2*l
2030  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
2031  dst_m(indl) = work(l+1) * vscales(indl)
2032  dst_m(indl-l:indl-1) = zero
2033  dst_m(indl+1:indl+l) = zero
2034  end do
2035  else
2036  do l = 0, p
2037  ! Index of Y_l^0
2038  indl = indl + 2*l
2039  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
2040  dst_m(indl) = beta*dst_m(indl) + work(l+1)*vscales(indl)
2041  dst_m(indl-l:indl-1) = beta * dst_m(indl-l:indl-1)
2042  dst_m(indl+1:indl+l) = beta * dst_m(indl+1:indl+l)
2043  end do
2044  end if
2045  end if
2046  end if
2047 end subroutine fmm_m2p_bessel_adj_work
2048 
2072 subroutine fmm_m2p_mat(c, r, p, vscales, mat)
2073  ! Inputs
2074  integer, intent(in) :: p
2075  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), r, vscales((p+1)**2)
2076  ! Output
2077  real(dp), intent(out) :: mat((p+1)**2)
2078  ! Local variables
2079  real(dp) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, vcos(p+1), vsin(p+1)
2080  real(dp) :: vylm((p+1)**2), vplm((p+1)**2), rcoef, t, tmp
2081  integer :: n, ind
2082  ! Get radius and values of spherical harmonics
2083  call ylmbas(c, rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, p, vscales, vylm, vplm, &
2084  & vcos, vsin)
2085  ! In case of a singularity (rho=zero) induced potential is infinite and is
2086  ! not taken into account.
2087  if (rho .eq. zero) then
2088  return
2089  end if
2090  ! Compute actual induced potentials
2091  rcoef = r / rho
2092  t = one
2093  do n = 0, p
2094  t = t * rcoef
2095  ind = n*n + n + 1
2096  mat(ind-n:ind+n) = t / vscales(ind)**2 * vylm(ind-n:ind+n)
2097  end do
2098 end subroutine fmm_m2p_mat
2099 
2125 subroutine fmm_l2p(c, src_r, p, vscales, alpha, src_l, beta, dst_v)
2126  ! Inputs
2127  integer, intent(in) :: p
2128  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_r, vscales((p+1)*(p+1)), alpha, &
2129  & src_l((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
2130  ! Output
2131  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_v
2132  ! Workspace
2133  real(dp) :: work(p+1)
2134  ! Call corresponding work routine
2135  call fmm_l2p_work(c, src_r, p, vscales, alpha, src_l, beta, dst_v, work)
2136 end subroutine fmm_l2p
2137 
2164 subroutine fmm_l2p_work(c, src_r, p, vscales_rel, alpha, src_l, beta, dst_v, &
2165  & work)
2166  ! Inputs
2167  integer, intent(in) :: p
2168  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_r, vscales_rel((p+1)*(p+1)), alpha, &
2169  & src_l((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
2170  ! Output
2171  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_v
2172  ! Workspace
2173  real(dp), intent(out), target :: work(p+1)
2174  ! Local variables
2175  real(dp) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, rcoef, t, tmp, tmp1, tmp2, &
2176  & tmp3, fl, max12, ssq12, pl2m, pl1m, plm, pmm, cmphi, smphi, ylm
2177  integer :: l, m, indl
2178  ! Scale output
2179  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2180  dst_v = zero
2181  else
2182  dst_v = beta * dst_v
2183  end if
2184  ! In case of zero alpha nothing else is required no matter what is the
2185  ! value of the induced potential
2186  if (alpha .eq. zero) then
2187  return
2188  end if
2189  ! Get spherical coordinates
2190  if (c(1) .eq. zero) then
2191  max12 = abs(c(2))
2192  ssq12 = one
2193  else if (abs(c(2)) .gt. abs(c(1))) then
2194  max12 = abs(c(2))
2195  ssq12 = one + (c(1)/c(2))**2
2196  else
2197  max12 = abs(c(1))
2198  ssq12 = one + (c(2)/c(1))**2
2199  end if
2200  ! Then we compute rho
2201  if (c(3) .eq. zero) then
2202  rho = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
2203  else if (abs(c(3)) .gt. max12) then
2204  rho = one + ssq12 *(max12/c(3))**2
2205  rho = abs(c(3)) * sqrt(rho)
2206  else
2207  rho = ssq12 + (c(3)/max12)**2
2208  rho = max12 * sqrt(rho)
2209  end if
2210  ! In case of a singularity (rho=zero) induced potential depends only on the
2211  ! leading 1-st spherical harmonic
2212  if (rho .eq. zero) then
2213  dst_v = dst_v + alpha*src_l(1)*vscales_rel(1)
2214  return
2215  end if
2216  ! Compute the actual induced potential
2217  rcoef = rho / src_r
2218  ! Length of a vector x(1:2)
2219  stheta = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
2220  ! Case x(1:2) != 0
2221  if (stheta .ne. zero) then
2222  ! Normalize cphi and sphi
2223  cphi = c(1) / stheta
2224  sphi = c(2) / stheta
2225  ! Normalize ctheta and stheta
2226  ctheta = c(3) / rho
2227  stheta = stheta / rho
2228  ! Treat easy cases
2229  select case(p)
2230  case (0)
2231  ! l = 0
2232  dst_v = dst_v + alpha*vscales_rel(1)*src_l(1)
2233  return
2234  case (1)
2235  ! l = 0
2236  tmp = src_l(1) * vscales_rel(1)
2237  ! l = 1
2238  tmp2 = ctheta * src_l(3) * vscales_rel(3)
2239  tmp3 = vscales_rel(4) * stheta
2240  tmp2 = tmp2 - tmp3*sphi*src_l(2)
2241  tmp2 = tmp2 - tmp3*cphi*src_l(4)
2242  dst_v = dst_v + alpha*(tmp+rcoef*tmp2)
2243  return
2244  end select
2245  ! Now p>1
2246  ! Precompute alpha*rcoef^l
2247  work(1) = alpha
2248  do l = 1, p
2249  work(l+1) = rcoef * work(l)
2250  end do
2251  ! Case m = 0
2252  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
2253  pl2m = one
2254  dst_v = dst_v + work(1)*src_l(1)*vscales_rel(1)
2255  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
2256  pmm = -stheta
2257  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
2258  pl1m = ctheta
2259  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel(3)
2260  dst_v = dst_v + work(2)*src_l(3)*ylm
2261  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
2262  do l = 2, p
2263  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
2264  plm = plm / dble(l)
2265  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1)
2266  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*src_l(l*l+l+1)*ylm
2267  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
2268  pl2m = pl1m
2269  pl1m = plm
2270  end do
2271  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
2272  cmphi = cphi
2273  smphi = sphi
2274  ! Case 0<m<p
2275  do m = 1, p-1
2276  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
2277  pl2m = pmm
2278  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((m+1)**2)
2279  tmp1 = cmphi*src_l((m+1)**2) + smphi*src_l(m*m+1)
2280  dst_v = dst_v + work(m+1)*ylm*tmp1
2281  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
2282  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
2283  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
2284  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
2285  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
2286  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
2287  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel((m+1)*(m+3))
2288  tmp1 = cmphi*src_l((m+1)*(m+3)) + smphi*src_l((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m)
2289  dst_v = dst_v + work(m+2)*ylm*tmp1
2290  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
2291  do l = m+2, p
2292  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
2293  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
2294  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1+m)
2295  tmp1 = cmphi*src_l(l*l+l+1+m) + smphi*src_l(l*l+l+1-m)
2296  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*ylm*tmp1
2297  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
2298  pl2m = pl1m
2299  pl1m = plm
2300  end do
2301  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
2302  tmp1 = cmphi
2303  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
2304  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
2305  end do
2306  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
2307  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((p+1)**2)
2308  tmp1 = cmphi*src_l((p+1)**2) + smphi*src_l(p*p+1)
2309  dst_v = dst_v + work(p+1)*ylm*tmp1
2310  ! Case of x(1:2) = 0 and x(3) != 0
2311  else
2312  ! In this case Y_l^m = 0 for m != 0, so only case m = 0 is taken into
2313  ! account. Y_l^m = ctheta^m in this case where ctheta is either +1 or
2314  ! -1. So, we copy sign(ctheta) into rcoef.
2315  rcoef = sign(rcoef, c(3))
2316  ! Init t and proceed with accumulation of a potential
2317  t = alpha
2318  indl = 1
2319  do l = 0, p
2320  ! Index of Y_l^0
2321  indl = indl + 2*l
2322  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
2323  dst_v = dst_v + t*src_l(indl)*vscales_rel(indl)
2324  ! Update t
2325  t = t * rcoef
2326  end do
2327  end if
2328 end subroutine fmm_l2p_work
2329 
2355 subroutine fmm_l2p_bessel(c, src_r, p, vscales, alpha, src_l, beta, dst_v)
2356  ! Inputs
2357  integer, intent(in) :: p
2358  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_r, vscales((p+1)*(p+1)), alpha, &
2359  & src_l((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
2360  ! Output
2361  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_v
2362  ! Temporary workspace
2363  complex(dp) :: work_complex(max(2, p+1))
2364  real(dp) :: work(p+1)
2365  ! Local variables
2366  real(dp) :: src_si(p+1)
2367  ! Call corresponding work routine
2368  call modified_spherical_bessel_first_kind(p, src_r, src_si, work, &
2369  & work_complex)
2370  call fmm_l2p_bessel_work(c, p, vscales, src_si, alpha, src_l, beta, &
2371  & dst_v, work_complex, work)
2372 end subroutine fmm_l2p_bessel
2373 
2400 subroutine fmm_l2p_bessel_work(c, p, vscales, SI_ri, alpha, src_l, beta, &
2401  & dst_v, work_complex, work)
2402  use complex_bessel
2403  !! Inputs
2404  integer, intent(in) :: p
2405  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), vscales((p+1)*(p+1)), alpha, &
2406  & src_l((p+1)*(p+1)), beta, SI_ri(p+1)
2407  !! Output
2408  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_v
2409  !! Workspace
2410  complex(dp), intent(out) :: work_complex(p+1)
2411  real(dp), intent(out) :: work(p+1)
2412  !! Local variables
2413  real(dp) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, rcoef, t, tmp, tmp1, tmp2, &
2414  & tmp3, fl, max12, ssq12, pl2m, pl1m, plm, pmm, cmphi, smphi, ylm
2415  real(dp) :: scaling_factor
2416  complex(dp) :: complex_argument
2417  integer :: l, m, indl, ierr, NZ
2418  real(dp), parameter :: fnu=1.5d0
2419  ! Scale output
2420  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2421  dst_v = zero
2422  else
2423  dst_v = beta * dst_v
2424  end if
2425  ! In case of zero alpha nothing else is required no matter what is the
2426  ! value of the induced potential
2427  if (alpha .eq. zero) then
2428  return
2429  end if
2430  ! Get spherical coordinates
2431  if (c(1) .eq. zero) then
2432  max12 = abs(c(2))
2433  ssq12 = one
2434  else if (abs(c(2)) .gt. abs(c(1))) then
2435  max12 = abs(c(2))
2436  ssq12 = one + (c(1)/c(2))**2
2437  else
2438  max12 = abs(c(1))
2439  ssq12 = one + (c(2)/c(1))**2
2440  end if
2441  ! Then we compute rho
2442  if (c(3) .eq. zero) then
2443  rho = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
2444  else if (abs(c(3)) .gt. max12) then
2445  rho = one + ssq12 *(max12/c(3))**2
2446  rho = abs(c(3)) * sqrt(rho)
2447  else
2448  rho = ssq12 + (c(3)/max12)**2
2449  rho = max12 * sqrt(rho)
2450  end if
2451  ! In case of a singularity (rho=zero) induced potential depends only on the
2452  ! leading 1-st spherical harmonic and the value I_0(0)=1
2453  if (rho .eq. zero) then
2454  dst_v = dst_v + alpha*src_l(1)*vscales(1)/si_ri(1)
2455  return
2456  end if
2457  ! Compute Bessel function
2458  scaling_factor = alpha * sqrt(pi / (2*rho))
2459  ! NOTE: Complex argument is required to call I_J(x)
2460  complex_argument = rho
2461  ! Compute for l = 0
2462  call cbesi(complex_argument, pt5, 1, 1, work_complex(1), nz, ierr)
2463  ! Compute for l = 1,...,p
2464  if (p .gt. 0) then
2465  call cbesi(complex_argument, fnu, 1, p, work_complex(2:p+1), nz, ierr)
2466  end if
2467  work = scaling_factor * real(work_complex) / si_ri
2468  ! Compute the actual induced potential
2469  ! Length of a vector x(1:2)
2470  stheta = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
2471  ! Case x(1:2) != 0
2472  if (stheta .ne. zero) then
2473  ! Normalize cphi and sphi
2474  cphi = c(1) / stheta
2475  sphi = c(2) / stheta
2476  ! Normalize ctheta and stheta
2477  ctheta = c(3) / rho
2478  stheta = stheta / rho
2479  ! Treat easy cases
2480  select case(p)
2481  case (0)
2482  ! l = 0
2483  dst_v = dst_v + work(1)*vscales(1)*src_l(1)
2484  return
2485  case (1)
2486  ! l = 0
2487  tmp = work(1) * src_l(1) * vscales(1)
2488  ! l = 1
2489  tmp2 = ctheta * src_l(3) * vscales(3)
2490  tmp3 = stheta * vscales(4)
2491  tmp2 = tmp2 - tmp3*sphi*src_l(2)
2492  tmp2 = tmp2 - tmp3*cphi*src_l(4)
2493  dst_v = dst_v + tmp + work(2)*tmp2
2494  return
2495  end select
2496  ! Now p>1
2497  ! Case m = 0
2498  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
2499  pl2m = one
2500  dst_v = dst_v + work(1)*src_l(1)*vscales(1)
2501  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
2502  pmm = -stheta
2503  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
2504  pl1m = ctheta
2505  ylm = pl1m * vscales(3)
2506  dst_v = dst_v + work(2)*src_l(3)*ylm
2507  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
2508  do l = 2, p
2509  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
2510  plm = plm / dble(l)
2511  ylm = plm * vscales(l*l+l+1)
2512  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*src_l(l*l+l+1)*ylm
2513  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
2514  pl2m = pl1m
2515  pl1m = plm
2516  end do
2517  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
2518  cmphi = cphi
2519  smphi = sphi
2520  ! Case 0<m<p
2521  do m = 1, p-1
2522  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
2523  pl2m = pmm
2524  ylm = pmm * vscales((m+1)**2)
2525  tmp1 = cmphi*src_l((m+1)**2) + smphi*src_l(m*m+1)
2526  dst_v = dst_v + work(m+1)*ylm*tmp1
2527  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
2528  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
2529  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
2530  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
2531  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
2532  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
2533  ylm = pl1m * vscales((m+1)*(m+3))
2534  tmp1 = cmphi*src_l((m+1)*(m+3)) + smphi*src_l((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m)
2535  dst_v = dst_v + work(m+2)*ylm*tmp1
2536  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
2537  do l = m+2, p
2538  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
2539  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
2540  ylm = plm * vscales(l*l+l+1+m)
2541  tmp1 = cmphi*src_l(l*l+l+1+m) + smphi*src_l(l*l+l+1-m)
2542  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*ylm*tmp1
2543  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
2544  pl2m = pl1m
2545  pl1m = plm
2546  end do
2547  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
2548  tmp1 = cmphi
2549  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
2550  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
2551  end do
2552  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
2553  ylm = pmm * vscales((p+1)**2)
2554  tmp1 = cmphi*src_l((p+1)**2) + smphi*src_l(p*p+1)
2555  dst_v = dst_v + work(p+1)*ylm*tmp1
2556  ! Case of x(1:2) = 0 and x(3) != 0
2557  else
2558  ! In this case Y_l^m = 0 for m != 0, so only case m = 0 is taken into
2559  ! account. Y_l^0 = ctheta^l in this case where ctheta is either +1 or
2560  ! -1. So, we copy sign(ctheta) into rcoef. But before that we
2561  ! initialize alpha/r factor for l=0 case without taking possible sign
2562  ! into account.
2563  t = one
2564  if (c(3) .lt. zero) then
2565  ! Proceed with accumulation of a potential
2566  indl = 1
2567  do l = 0, p
2568  ! Index of Y_l^0
2569  indl = indl + 2*l
2570  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
2571  dst_v = dst_v + t*work(l+1)*src_l(indl)*vscales(indl)
2572  t = -t
2573  end do
2574  else
2575  ! Proceed with accumulation of a potential
2576  indl = 1
2577  do l = 0, p
2578  ! Index of Y_l^0
2579  indl = indl + 2*l
2580  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
2581  dst_v = dst_v + work(l+1)*src_l(indl)*vscales(indl)
2582  end do
2583  end if
2584  end if
2585 end subroutine fmm_l2p_bessel_work
2586 
2587 subroutine fmm_l2p_bessel_grad(c, src_r, p, vscales, alpha, src_l, beta, dst_g)
2588  use complex_bessel
2589  ! Inputs
2590  integer, intent(in) :: p
2591  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_r, vscales((p+2)*(p+2)), alpha, &
2592  & src_l((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
2593  ! Output
2594  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_g(3)
2595  ! Temporary workspace
2596  complex(dp) :: work_complex(p+2)
2597  real(dp) :: work(p+2), src_si(p+2), vcnk(1), src_l_grad((p+2)**2, 3)
2598  ! Call corresponding work routine
2599  call modified_spherical_bessel_first_kind(p+1, src_r, src_si, work, &
2600  & work_complex)
2601  call fmm_l2l_bessel_grad(p, src_si, vscales, vcnk, src_l, src_l_grad)
2602  call fmm_l2p_bessel_work(c, p+1, vscales, src_si, -alpha, src_l_grad(:, 1), &
2603  & beta, dst_g(1), work_complex, work)
2604  call fmm_l2p_bessel_work(c, p+1, vscales, src_si, -alpha, src_l_grad(:, 2), &
2605  & beta, dst_g(2), work_complex, work)
2606  call fmm_l2p_bessel_work(c, p+1, vscales, src_si, -alpha, src_l_grad(:, 3), &
2607  & beta, dst_g(3), work_complex, work)
2608 end subroutine fmm_l2p_bessel_grad
2609 
2634 subroutine fmm_l2p_adj(c, src_q, dst_r, p, vscales_rel, beta, dst_l)
2635  ! Inputs
2636  integer, intent(in) :: p
2637  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_q, dst_r, vscales_rel((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
2638  ! Output
2639  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_l((p+1)**2)
2640  ! Workspace
2641  real(dp) :: work(p+1)
2642  ! Call corresponding work routine
2643  call fmm_l2p_adj_work(c, src_q, dst_r, p, vscales_rel, beta, dst_l, work)
2644 end subroutine fmm_l2p_adj
2645 
2671 subroutine fmm_l2p_adj_work(c, src_q, dst_r, p, vscales_rel, beta, dst_l, work)
2672  ! Inputs
2673  integer, intent(in) :: p
2674  real(dp), intent(in) :: c(3), src_q, dst_r, vscales_rel((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
2675  ! Output
2676  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst_l((p+1)**2)
2677  ! Workspace
2678  real(dp), intent(out), target :: work(p+1)
2679  ! Local variables
2680  real(dp) :: rho, ctheta, stheta, cphi, sphi, rcoef, t, tmp, tmp1, tmp2, &
2681  & tmp3, fl, max12, ssq12, pl2m, pl1m, plm, pmm, cmphi, smphi, ylm
2682  integer :: l, m, indl
2683  ! In case src_q is zero just scale output properly
2684  if (src_q .eq. zero) then
2685  ! Zero init output if beta is also zero
2686  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2687  dst_l = zero
2688  ! Scale output by beta otherwise
2689  else
2690  dst_l = beta * dst_l
2691  end if
2692  ! Exit subroutine
2693  return
2694  end if
2695  ! Now src_q is non-zero
2696  ! Get spherical coordinates
2697  if (c(1) .eq. zero) then
2698  max12 = abs(c(2))
2699  ssq12 = one
2700  else if (abs(c(2)) .gt. abs(c(1))) then
2701  max12 = abs(c(2))
2702  ssq12 = one + (c(1)/c(2))**2
2703  else
2704  max12 = abs(c(1))
2705  ssq12 = one + (c(2)/c(1))**2
2706  end if
2707  ! Then we compute rho
2708  if (c(3) .eq. zero) then
2709  rho = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
2710  else if (abs(c(3)) .gt. max12) then
2711  rho = one + ssq12 *(max12/c(3))**2
2712  rho = abs(c(3)) * sqrt(rho)
2713  else
2714  rho = ssq12 + (c(3)/max12)**2
2715  rho = max12 * sqrt(rho)
2716  end if
2717  ! In case of a singularity (rho=zero) induced potential depends only on the
2718  ! leading 1-st spherical harmonic, so in adjoint way we update only the leading
2719  if (rho .eq. zero) then
2720  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2721  dst_l(1) = src_q * vscales_rel(1)
2722  dst_l(2:) = zero
2723  else
2724  dst_l(1) = beta*dst_l(1) + src_q*vscales_rel(1)
2725  dst_l(2:) = beta * dst_l(2:)
2726  end if
2727  return
2728  end if
2729  ! Compute the actual induced potential
2730  rcoef = rho / dst_r
2731  ! Length of a vector x(1:2)
2732  stheta = max12 * sqrt(ssq12)
2733  ! Case x(1:2) != 0
2734  if (stheta .ne. zero) then
2735  ! Normalize cphi and sphi
2736  cphi = c(1) / stheta
2737  sphi = c(2) / stheta
2738  ! Normalize ctheta and stheta
2739  ctheta = c(3) / rho
2740  stheta = stheta / rho
2741  ! Treat easy cases
2742  select case(p)
2743  case (0)
2744  ! l = 0
2745  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2746  dst_l(1) = src_q * vscales_rel(1)
2747  else
2748  dst_l(1) = beta*dst_l(1) + src_q*vscales_rel(1)
2749  end if
2750  return
2751  case (1)
2752  ! l = 0 and l = 1
2753  tmp = src_q * rcoef
2754  tmp2 = -tmp * vscales_rel(4) * stheta
2755  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2756  dst_l(1) = src_q * vscales_rel(1)
2757  dst_l(2) = tmp2 * sphi
2758  dst_l(3) = tmp * vscales_rel(3) * ctheta
2759  dst_l(4) = tmp2 * cphi
2760  else
2761  dst_l(1) = beta*dst_l(1) + src_q*vscales_rel(1)
2762  dst_l(2) = beta*dst_l(2) + tmp2*sphi
2763  dst_l(3) = beta*dst_l(3) + tmp*vscales_rel(3)*ctheta
2764  dst_l(4) = beta*dst_l(4) + tmp2*cphi
2765  end if
2766  return
2767  end select
2768  ! Now p>1
2769  ! Precompute src_q*rcoef^l
2770  work(1) = src_q
2771  do l = 1, p
2772  work(l+1) = rcoef * work(l)
2773  end do
2774  ! Overwrite output
2775  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2776  ! Case m = 0
2777  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
2778  pl2m = one
2779  dst_l(1) = work(1) * vscales_rel(1)
2780  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
2781  pmm = -stheta
2782  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
2783  pl1m = ctheta
2784  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel(3)
2785  dst_l(3) = work(2) * ylm
2786  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
2787  do l = 2, p
2788  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
2789  plm = plm / dble(l)
2790  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1)
2791  dst_l(l*l+l+1) = work(l+1) * ylm
2792  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
2793  pl2m = pl1m
2794  pl1m = plm
2795  end do
2796  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
2797  cmphi = cphi
2798  smphi = sphi
2799  ! Case 0<m<p
2800  do m = 1, p-1
2801  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
2802  pl2m = pmm
2803  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((m+1)**2)
2804  ylm = work(m+1) * ylm
2805  dst_l((m+1)**2) = cmphi * ylm
2806  dst_l(m*m+1) = smphi * ylm
2807  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
2808  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
2809  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
2810  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
2811  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
2812  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
2813  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel((m+1)*(m+3))
2814  ylm = work(m+2) * ylm
2815  dst_l((m+1)*(m+3)) = cmphi * ylm
2816  dst_l((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m) = smphi * ylm
2817  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
2818  do l = m+2, p
2819  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
2820  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
2821  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1+m)
2822  ylm = work(l+1) * ylm
2823  dst_l(l*l+l+1+m) = cmphi * ylm
2824  dst_l(l*l+l+1-m) = smphi * ylm
2825  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
2826  pl2m = pl1m
2827  pl1m = plm
2828  end do
2829  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
2830  tmp1 = cmphi
2831  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
2832  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
2833  end do
2834  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
2835  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((p+1)**2)
2836  ylm = work(p+1) * ylm
2837  dst_l((p+1)**2) = cmphi * ylm
2838  dst_l(p*p+1) = smphi * ylm
2839  ! Update output
2840  else
2841  ! Case m = 0
2842  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_0^0 now
2843  pl2m = one
2844  dst_l(1) = beta*dst_l(1) + work(1)*vscales_rel(1)
2845  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
2846  pmm = -stheta
2847  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
2848  pl1m = ctheta
2849  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel(3)
2850  dst_l(3) = beta*dst_l(3) + work(2)*ylm
2851  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
2852  do l = 2, p
2853  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l-1)*pl2m
2854  plm = plm / dble(l)
2855  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1)
2856  dst_l(l*l+l+1) = beta*dst_l(l*l+l+1) + work(l+1)*ylm
2857  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
2858  pl2m = pl1m
2859  pl1m = plm
2860  end do
2861  ! Prepare cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for m=1
2862  cmphi = cphi
2863  smphi = sphi
2864  ! Case 0<m<p
2865  do m = 1, p-1
2866  ! P_{l-2}^m which is P_m^m now
2867  pl2m = pmm
2868  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((m+1)**2)
2869  ylm = work(m+1) * ylm
2870  dst_l((m+1)**2) = beta*dst_l((m+1)**2) + cmphi*ylm
2871  dst_l(m*m+1) = beta*dst_l(m*m+1) + smphi*ylm
2872  ! Temporary to reduce number of operations
2873  tmp1 = dble(2*m+1) * pmm
2874  ! Update P_m^m for the next iteration
2875  pmm = -stheta * tmp1
2876  ! P_{l-1}^m which is P_{m+1}^m now
2877  pl1m = ctheta * tmp1
2878  ylm = pl1m * vscales_rel((m+1)*(m+3))
2879  ylm = work(m+2) * ylm
2880  dst_l((m+1)*(m+3)) = beta*dst_l((m+1)*(m+3)) + cmphi*ylm
2881  dst_l((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m) = beta*dst_l((m+1)*(m+2)+1-m) + &
2882  & smphi*ylm
2883  ! P_l^m for l>m+1
2884  do l = m+2, p
2885  plm = dble(2*l-1)*ctheta*pl1m - dble(l+m-1)*pl2m
2886  plm = plm / dble(l-m)
2887  ylm = plm * vscales_rel(l*l+l+1+m)
2888  ylm = work(l+1) * ylm
2889  dst_l(l*l+l+1+m) = beta*dst_l(l*l+l+1+m) + cmphi*ylm
2890  dst_l(l*l+l+1-m) = beta*dst_l(l*l+l+1-m) + smphi*ylm
2891  ! Update P_{l-2}^m and P_{l-1}^m for the next iteration
2892  pl2m = pl1m
2893  pl1m = plm
2894  end do
2895  ! Update cos(m*phi) and sin(m*phi) for the next iteration
2896  tmp1 = cmphi
2897  cmphi = cmphi*cphi - smphi*sphi
2898  smphi = tmp1*sphi + smphi*cphi
2899  end do
2900  ! Case m=p requires only to use P_m^m
2901  ylm = pmm * vscales_rel((p+1)**2)
2902  ylm = work(p+1) * ylm
2903  dst_l((p+1)**2) = beta*dst_l((p+1)**2) + cmphi*ylm
2904  dst_l(p*p+1) = beta*dst_l(p*p+1) + smphi*ylm
2905  end if
2906  ! Case of x(1:2) = 0 and x(3) != 0
2907  else
2908  ! In this case Y_l^m = 0 for m != 0, so only case m = 0 is taken into
2909  ! account. Y_l^m = ctheta^m in this case where ctheta is either +1 or
2910  ! -1. So, we copy sign(ctheta) into rcoef.
2911  rcoef = sign(rcoef, c(3))
2912  ! Init t and proceed with accumulation of a potential
2913  t = src_q
2914  indl = 1
2915  ! Overwrite output
2916  if (beta .eq. zero) then
2917  do l = 0, p
2918  ! Index of Y_l^0
2919  indl = indl + 2*l
2920  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
2921  dst_l(indl) = t * vscales_rel(indl)
2922  dst_l(indl-l:indl-1) = zero
2923  dst_l(indl+1:indl+l) = zero
2924  ! Update t
2925  t = t * rcoef
2926  end do
2927  ! Update output
2928  else
2929  do l = 0, p
2930  ! Index of Y_l^0
2931  indl = indl + 2*l
2932  ! Add 4*pi/(2*l+1)*rcoef^{l+1}*Y_l^0 contribution
2933  dst_l(indl) = beta*dst_l(indl) + t*vscales_rel(indl)
2934  dst_l(indl-l:indl-1) = beta * dst_l(indl-l:indl-1)
2935  dst_l(indl+1:indl+l) = beta * dst_l(indl+1:indl+l)
2936  ! Update t
2937  t = t * rcoef
2938  end do
2939  end if
2940  end if
2941 end subroutine fmm_l2p_adj_work
2942 
2997 subroutine fmm_sph_transform(p, r1, alpha, src, beta, dst)
2998  ! Inputs
2999  integer, intent(in) :: p
3000  real(dp), intent(in) :: r1(-1:1, -1:1), alpha, src((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
3001  ! Output
3002  real(dp), intent(inout) :: dst((p+1)*(p+1))
3003  ! Temporary workspace
3004  real(dp) :: work(2*(2*p+1)*(2*p+3))
3005  ! Call corresponding work routine
3006  call fmm_sph_transform_work(p, r1, alpha, src, beta, dst, work)
3007 end subroutine fmm_sph_transform
3008 
3022 subroutine fmm_sph_transform_work(p, r1, alpha, src, beta, dst, work)
3023  ! Inputs
3024  integer, intent(in) :: p
3025  real(dp), intent(in) :: r1(-1:1, -1:1), alpha, src((p+1)*(p+1)), beta
3026  ! Output
3027  real(dp), intent(out) :: dst((p+1)*(p+1))
3028  ! Temporary workspace
3029  real(dp), intent(out), target :: work(2*(2*p+1)*(2*p+3))
3030  ! Local variables
3031  real(dp) :: u, v, w
3032  integer :: l, m, n, ind
3033  ! Pointers for a workspace
3034  real(dp), pointer :: r_prev(:, :), r(:, :), scal_uvw_m(:), scal_u_n(:), &
3035  & scal_v_n(:), scal_w_n(:), r_swap(:, :)
3036  ! In case alpha is zero just scale output
3037  if (alpha .eq. zero) then
3038  ! Set output to zero if beta is also zero
3039  if (beta .eq. zero) then
3040  dst = zero
3041  else
3042  dst = beta * dst
3043  end if
3044  ! Exit subroutine
3045  return
3046  end if
3047  ! Now alpha is non-zero
3048  ! In case beta is zero output is just overwritten without being read
3049  if (beta .eq. zero) then
3050  ! Compute rotations/reflections
3051  ! l = 0
3052  dst(1) = alpha * src(1)
3053  if (p .eq. 0) then
3054  return
3055  end if
3056  ! l = 1
3057  dst(2) = alpha * dot_product(r1(-1:1,-1), src(2:4))
3058  dst(3) = alpha * dot_product(r1(-1:1,0), src(2:4))
3059  dst(4) = alpha * dot_product(r1(-1:1,1), src(2:4))
3060  if (p .eq. 1) then
3061  return
3062  end if
3063  ! Set pointers
3064  n = 2*p + 1
3065  l = n ** 2
3066  r_prev(-p:p, -p:p) => work(1:l)
3067  m = 2*l
